comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: Notes from the Item Description: "Mr. and Mrs H.L. Worley, from Longview, Washington, are picking hops at the Mitoma Hop Yard near Independence. He is a Texan; she is a Minnesotan. He was a Marine private during the war and saw service at Bremerton, Washington. Presently, he is a second rigger in the woods and is picking hops while the woods are closed as a fire [precaution]. $8.13 one day--August 21 [1946]"
